profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: William Romaine Newbold (1865-1926) was the Adam Seybert Professor of Intellectual and Moral Philosophy at the University of Pennsylvania from 1907-1926. He served as Dean of the Graduate School from 1896-1904. He did (now discredited) work on deciphering the coded text known as the Voynich Manuscript.

scopecontent.p: This is a typed manuscript of William R. Newbold's "Greek Theories of Sound and Consonance," 1907. The manuscript is annotated with excerpts of text in Greek and corrections in English. It was never published. The collection also includes several letters regarding the proposed publication of the manuscript (after Newbold's death), including a critique of the work by Otto Kinkeldey of Cornell University Library.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
